project.name: Kiwi.js
project.description: Kiwi.js is a Javascript/Typescript library for creating HTML5 games.

Kiwi.name: Kiwi
Kiwi.description:
Module - Kiwi (Core)
The top level namespace in which all core classes and modules are defined.

Manager.name: Manager
Manager.description: A Proxy to the Clock and Time related classes. Access this via Kiwi.Game.Clock
Manager.author: egraether / http://egraether.com/

Tween.name: Tween
Tween.description:
Based on tween.js by sole. Converted to TypeScript and integrated into Kiwi.
https://github.com/sole/tween.js
Tween.author: egraether / http://egraether.com/

ArcadePhysics.name: ArcadePhysics
ArcadePhysics.description:
Ported from Flixel, most functions operation identically to the original flixel functions, though some
have been split into multiple functions. Generally where functions originally accepted
either groups or gameobjects within the same argument, the ported functions one or the other.
http://www.flixel.org/
http://www.adamatomic.com/
ArcadePhysics.author: Adam 'Atomic' Saltsman, Flixel

Camera.name: Camera
Camera.description:
My method description.  Like other pieces of your comment blocks, 
this can span multiple lines.

Component.name: Component
Component.description: The base class that all components extend from.

ComponentManager.name: ComponentManager
ComponentManager.description:
The component manager is a class that is used to handle a number of components that are active on a particular object.
This way if you want to check to see if a particular component is on an object you can ask the component manager, 
Or when updating components you can tell the component manager to update and all of the components will update as well.

Entity.name: Entity
Entity.description:
Serves as a container for game objects to extend from. 
Each Entity has a unique ID (UID) which is automatically generated upon instantiation.

Game.name: Game
Game.description:
My method description.  Like other pieces of your comment blocks, 
this can span multiple lines.

Signal.name: Signal
Signal.description:
A TypeScript conversion of JS Signals by Miller Medeiros.
Released under the MIT license
http://millermedeiros.github.com/js-signals/
Signal.author: Miller Medeiros, JS Signals

SignalBinding.name: SignalBinding
SignalBinding.description:
An object that represents a binding between a Signal and a listener function.
Released under the MIT license
http://millermedeiros.github.com/js-signals/
SignalBinding.author: Miller Medeiros, JS Signals

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: A game contains one single Stage which controls the size of the game, frame rate, position, e.t.c.

StateManager.name: StateManager
StateManager.description: The state manager handles the starting, parsing, looping and swapping of game states. Thus there is only ever one state manager per game.

File.name: File
File.description: Handles the loading of external data files via a tag loader or xhr + arraybuffer, and optionally saves to the file store.

StaticImage.name: StaticImage
StaticImage.description: A light weight game object for displaying static images (such as backgrounds) that would have little or no interaction with other game objects.

Circle.name: Circle
Circle.description: Creates a new Circle object with the center coordinate specified by the x and y parameters and the diameter specified by the diameter parameter. If you call this function without parameters, a circle with x, y, diameter and radius properties set to 0 is created.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the center of the circle.

Intersect.name: Intersect
Intersect.description: A collection of methods to help determine and return intersection between geometric objects.

IntersectResult.name: IntersectResult
IntersectResult.description: A light result object to hold the results of an intersection

Line.name: Line
Line.description: A line object is an infinte line through space. The two sets of x/y coordinates define the Line Segment.

Matrix.name: Matrix
Matrix.description: Matrix class used for mapping points between coordinate spaces.

params.name: a
params.description: position 0,0 of the matrix, affects scaling and rotation.

params.name: b
params.description: position 0,1 of the matrix, affects scaling and rotation.

params.name: c
params.description: position 1,0 of the matrix, affects scaling and rotation.

params.name: d
params.description: position 1,1 of the matrix, affects scaling and rotation.

params.name: tx
params.description: position 2,0 of the matrix, affects translation on x axis.

params.name: ty
params.description: position 2,1 of the matrix, affects translation on y axis.

Point.name: Point
Point.description: Creates a new point. If you pass no parameters to this method, a point is created at (0,0).

params.name: x
params.description: One-liner. Default is ?.

params.name: y
params.description: One-liner. Default is ?.

Ray.name: Ray
Ray.description: Represents a halfline. The ray starts at the first point and extends infinitely in the direction of the second.

Rectangle.name: Rectangle
Rectangle.description: Creates a new Rectangle object with the top-left corner specified by the x and y parameters and with the specified width and height parameters. If you call this function without parameters, a rectangle with x, y, width, and height properties set to 0 is created.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle in pixels.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle in pixels.

Transform.name: Transform
Transform.description:
Represents position, scale, rotation and rotationPoint of an Entity.
- Values can be transformed with a 3x3 affine transformation matrix, which each transform is assigned.
- A tranform can be assigned a parent, which may in turn have it's own parent, thereby creating a tranform inheritence heirarchy
- A concatenated transformation matrix, representing the combined matrices of the transform and its ancestors.

params.name: x
params.description: The x component of the vector.

params.name: y
params.description: The y component of the vector.

Key.name: Key
Key.description: A compact object that holds the most important details about a Keyboard Event response

Bootstrap.name: Bootstrap
Bootstrap.description: DOM Boot and Ready functions (based on those used by jQuery)

Browser.name: Browser
Browser.description:
Gets the x/y coordinate offset of any given valid DOM Element from the top/left position of the browser
Based on jQuery offset https://github.com/jquery/jquery/blob/master/src/offset.js

Device.name: Device
Device.description:
Detects device support capabilities. Using some elements from System.js by MrDoob and Modernizr
https://github.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/blob/master/feature-detects/audio.js
Device.author: Modernizr team

Clock.name: Clock
Clock.description: A clock class for keeping time.

params.name: name.
params.description: The name of the clock.

params.name: units.
params.description: The number of milliseconds that make up one unit of time on this clock.

MasterClock.name: MasterClock
MasterClock.description:
The masterclock tracks time elapsed since the application started.
You should not access it directly, use the Clock and Timer classes instead.

Timer.name: Timer
Timer.description:
The Timer class hooks into a game clock and allows you run code at a specified point in game time.
Use the start() method to start a timer. Add TimerEvents to set-up code to be run on the timer interval.
Timer objects can run once or repeat at specified intervals to execute code on a schedule.

Canvas.name: Canvas
Canvas.description: Creates a canvas DOM element and adds it to a layer.

Common.name: Common
Common.description:
Methods to assist in working with Structs.
A lot of the functions in this class are Copyright 2012 Mauricio Santos and used with permission.
His work is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License")
Common.author: Mauricio Santos

GameMath.name: GameMath
GameMath.description:
Adds a set of extra Math functions and extends a few commonly used ones.
Includes some methods written by Dylan Engelman.
GameMath.author: Dylan Engelman

RandomDataGenerator.name: RandomDataGenerator
RandomDataGenerator.description:
Manages the creation of unique internal game IDs.
Based on Nonsense by Josh Faul https://github.com/jocafa/Nonsense
Random number generator from http://baagoe.org/en/wiki/Better_random_numbers_for_javascript
RandomDataGenerator.author: Josh Faul

RequestAnimationFrame.name: RequestAnimationFrame
RequestAnimationFrame.description: Abstracts away the use of RAF or setTimeout for the core game update loop. The callback can be re-mapped on the fly.

GameManager.name: GameManager
GameManager.description: The GameManager maintains a list an array of all instances of Kiwi games within a single document.

classitems.description:
Either switchs to a particular animation or a particular frame in an animation depending on if you pass a string or a number. 
You can also force the animation to play or to stop by passing a boolean in. But if left as null, the animation will base it off what is currently happening.
So if the animation is currently 'playing' then once switched to the animation will play. If not currently playing it will switch to and stop.

classitems.description:
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc.
You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts from the previous game loop step.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc.
You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating collision directions.
Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here.
Useful for things like one-way platforms (e.g. allowCollisions = UP;)
The accessor "solid" just flips this variable between NONE and ANY.
Important variable for collision processing. By default this value is set automatically during preUpdate().
A boolean to indicate if this object is solid or not.
A function that is to execute when this object overlaps with another.
The context that the callback method should have when it executes.

Whether the object collides or not.  For more control over what directions
the object will collide from, use collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, etc)
to set the value of allowCollisions directly.

classitems.description:
Determines a point between two specified points. The parameter f determines where the new interpolated point is located relative to the two end points specified by parameters pt1 and pt2.
The closer the value of the parameter f is to 1.0, the closer the interpolated point is to the first point (parameter pt1). The closer the value of the parameter f is to 0, the closer the interpolated point is to the second point (parameter pt2).
classitems.name: interpolate

params.name: pointA
params.description: - The first Point object.

params.name: pointB
params.description: - The second Point object.

params.name: f
params.description: - The level of interpolation between the two points. Indicates where the new point will be, along the line between pt1 and pt2. If f=1, pt1 is returned; if f=0, pt2 is returned.

classitems.description:
Offsets the Point object by the specified amount. The value of dx is added to the original value of x to create the new x value.
The value of dy is added to the original value of y to create the new y value.

Compute the logarithm of any value of any base

a logarithm is the exponent that some constant (base) would have to be raised to 
to be equal to value.

i.e.
4 ^ x = 16
can be rewritten as to solve for x
logB4(16) = x
which with this function would be 
LoDMath.logBaseOf(16,4)

which would return 2, because 4^2 = 16
Greatest Common Denominator using Euclid's algorithm
Lowest Common Multiple

Factorial - N!

simple product series

by definition:
0! == 1

gamma function

defined: gamma(N) == (N - 1)!

falling factorial

defined: (N)! / (N - x)!

written subscript: (N)x OR (base)exp

rising factorial

defined: (N + x - 1)! / (N - 1)!

written superscript N^(x) OR base^(exp)

binomial coefficient

defined: N! / (k!(N-k)!)
reduced: N! / (N-k)! == (N)k (fallingfactorial)
reduced: (N)k / k!

rising binomial coefficient

as one can notice in the analysis of binCoef(...) that 
binCoef is the (N)k divided by k!. Similarly rising binCoef 
is merely N^(k) / k!

Generate a random boolean result based on the chance value

Returns true or false based on the chance value (default 50%). For example if you wanted a player to have a 30% chance of getting a bonus, call chanceRoll(30) - true means the chance passed, false means it failed.

params.name: chance
params.description: The chance of receiving the value. A number between 0 and 100 (effectively 0% to 100%)

return.description: true if the roll passed, or false
